channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: World leaders to hold emergency summit on Greenland. And, SCOTUS weighs Fed case
item.description: European leaders hold an emergency summit on a possible U.S.-Greenland deal. And, the Supreme Court weighs whether the president can fire Fed governor...

item.title: Trump vs. U.S. allies: How will this end?
item.description: The president has backed off his threat to take Greenland by force. But his highly inflammatory remarks in Switzerland rattled U.S. allies and threate...

item.title: Jack Smith to defend Trump investigations to House Republicans
item.description: Jack Smith's appearance before the House Judiciary Committee marks the first open testimony about his work after presiding over two federal criminal i...

item.title: Rahm Emanuel steers a course between 'monopolists' and 'Marxists'
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with longtime Democrat Rahm Emanuel about politics in the Trump era.

item.title: Some voters who backed Trump say ICE is going 'too far'
item.description: A new focus group of Biden-to-Trump voters weighs in on immigration operations and Trump's foreign affairs leadership on Greenland and Venezuela.

item.title: What to know about Trump's "Board of Peace"
item.description: The "Board of Peace" was first announced as part of the Trump administration's peace plan for Gaza. Mr. Trump led a signing for its founding charter i...

item.title: What we know about Trump's 'framework of future deal' over Greenland
item.description: Denmark and Greenland have made it clear they will not relinquish sovereignty of the world's largest island.

item.title: Ex-DEA agent learns fate for aiding drug traffickers: "Little dark secret"
item.description: Joseph Bongiovanni was accused of authoring bogus DEA reports, stealing sensitive files, throwing off colleagues and outing confidential informants.

item.title: Three dead in shooting in Australia's New South Wales
item.description: Residents have been told to stay indoors and avoid the area of the shooting.

item.title: UK holds off joining Trump's Board of Peace over Putin concerns
item.description: Foreign Secretary Yvette Cooper says the Russian president has shown no commitment to peace in Ukraine.

item.title: Trump administration expects the economy to roar this year. Here's why.
item.description: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick predicts that first-quarter economic growth will heat up to 5%. But sustaining that pace won't be easy, economists s...

item.title: Homicide rate declines sharply in dozens of US cities, a new report shows
Trump and his "Board of Peace" partners sign founding charter in Davos
item.description: President Trump joined fellow members of his "Board of Peace," signing its founding charter and pledging that the vaguely defined group will work with...

item.title: Zelensky and Trump to meet as US envoy says ending war with Russia down to one issue
item.description: US envoy Steve Witkoff said he was optimistic about a deal ahead of talks with Russia's Vladimir Putin.

item.title: Sneak peek: The Mother I Wish I Knew
item.description: ALL NEW: A daughter whose mother was murdered is convinced her father is innocent."48 Hours" correspondent Natalie Morales reports Saturday, Jan. 24 a...

item.title: Son-in-law of Venezuelan opposition candidate freed from jail, wife says
item.description: Rafael Tudares was arrested after his father-in-law, Edmundo González, ran against Nicolás Maduro in the election.

item.title: Immigration enforcement arrives in Maine as a court freezes restrictions on tactics in Minnesota
Immigration officers assert sweeping power to enter homes without a judge’s warrant, memo says
item.description: An Immigration and Customs Enforcement memo obtained by The Associated Press reveals that the agency allows immigration officers to forcibly enter hom...
